fulltext:
The Date and the Meaning of the Vettius Affair
51
My view,  then,  is that Vettius was an agent of Caesar who was trying to bring Curio into bad repute and thus put an end to his campaign for the election of magistrates unfriendly to Caesar.  The incident,  according to my dating,  took place in the middle of July when men were canvassing actively for all the offices,  and Caesar was,  I believe,  anxious about the outcome.  In his effort to discredit Curio Caesar blundered badly.  He derestimated his adversary,  and when Curio counterattacked Caesar was caught in an unprepared position.  I would suggest that it was this rience with Curio as an opponent that led the master politician to make a determined effort to win Curio as his political lieutenant.  Caesar suceeded,  and Curio fully justified the promise he had shown in the incident in which,  as I see it,  he had worsted Caesar
Bryn Mawr.  Lily Ross Taylor. 
16.  See Mommsen's comment on Curio,  „ es war ein Funken von Caesars eigenem Geist in dem feurigen Jüngling ",  R.  G.  III " 405.
